Summary: Luminescent orange sphere that flew in a straight line, pulsed out, pulsed on, disappeared.
divs: Sighting DetailsWhile watching neighborhood fireworks, my children came running up to the group and said they are watching a "falling star". We walked around the side of the house to investigate what we assumed were fireworks, and to our surprise, we watched a luminescent orange sphere low in the sky, coming from the East and then heading North across the sky. The object was moving quickly in what appeared to be a straight line, covering miles. There were no blinking lights that would identify it as a plane or helicopter, and there was no sound emanating from the object. It pulsed bright orange and then the light went out. It then came back on again, and then went out suddenly. We were very surprised because we knew it wasn't a plane or fireworks. About 30 minutes later, the same light appeared around the general location where we first spotted it, and it followed a straight line again across the sky. It was still a bright orange color, and once again made no sound. The lights were larger than those on a plane. It traveled across the sky and once again disappeared from view. It was not following the typical plane flight patterns that go over our neighborhood.
